steps.step: In a large skillet, cook the bacon over moderately high heat, stirring occasionally, until crisp, about 6 minutes.
Drain on paper towels; reserve 1/4 cup of fat.
In a large, enameled cast-iron casserole, melt the butter in the bacon fat.
Add the Brussels sprouts in batches and cook over high heat, stirring, until softened but still bright green, about 8 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Add the apples and thyme; cook, stirring, until the apples are warmed through.
Transfer the slaw to a platter, scatter the bacon on top and serve.
